title: Projects & Case Studies
text:
Electronic Health Record
Participated in the implementation of electronic health records at the hospital where I worked. As a supervising nurse in this digital transformation, I was actively involved, first in my own training for this new project and then in the training of the entire team.

Tools: EHR platform, Clinical documentation, Training and workflow guidelines, Internal communication tools.
Focus: Improve access to each patientâ€™s clinical information. Train clinical staff in digital workflows, ensuring compliance with hospital protocols and data protection regulations. Standardize patient records.
Outcome: Increased access to each patientâ€™s medical record, thereby improving decision-making and patient care.



COVID-19 Protection Training Program for Clinical Staff
I was part of the implementation of a hospital training program focused on COVID-19 prevention for hospital workers. As a supervising nurse during the pandemic, I was responsible for training new and existing staff to ensure the consistent application of safety protocols.

Tools: WHO and Chilean Ministry of Health guidelines on COVID-19. Training materials on personal protective equipment. Internal hospital protocols and workflow diagrams.
Focus: Correct use of personal protective equipment. Reduction in COVID-19 infections. Prevention of cross-contamination. Management of suspected and confirmed COVID-19 cases.
Outcome: Improved compliance with safety standards during patient care. Contributed to reducing the risk of transmission within the hospital.



OClient Accounts and Invoicing Tracking Spreadsheet
Summarized invoicing and reconciliation practices; proposed a simple tracking sheet to reduce discrepancies and improve cycle time.

Tools: Microsoft Excel, Client account records and service contracts, Email.
Focus: Facilitate access to customer data and existing invoices in one place. Organize invoices by customer, due date, and status for easier tracking and month-end closing.
Outcome: Easier identification of overdue invoices and accounts requiring follow-up. More efficient communication with customers regarding outstanding balances.

title: Home
text:
About
MBA candidate at University Canada West with a strong background spanning healthcare and finance. Over seven years as a Registered Nurse and more than two years as an Accounting Assistant in the cleaning and facilities services industry. Skilled in financial reporting, invoicing, client relationship management, and team collaboration. Career goal: roles at the intersection of finance, healthcare operations, and digital transformation.

Strong communication, empathy, and problem-solving under pressure.
